There is a condition called gastroparesis where the stomach gets bloated/distended after eating even a small amount of food.  Constipation can also be a problem with it.  Also, nausea and vomiting sometimes and almost always pain or at least discomfort after eating.  It basically means the stomach doesn't empty as fast as it should so the food piles up in there.  Have your mom ask her gastroenterologist or PCP about it and see what they think.  It is diagnosed by a gastric emptying scan in nuclear medicine.  Basically you sit under this scanner after eating eggs and milk with radioactive tracer in them and they take pictures to see how fast the food and liquids are leaving the stomach.  Sometimes people have this alone and sometimes in concert with other conditions, especially diabetes, but many others as well-neurologic disease, rheumatologic disease, thyroid disease, damage to the vagus nerve after stomach surgery, etc.  I have this condition so if you want to ask questions, ask and I will checkback.  Good luck to you.  If your mom has it she should eat small meals often (not big meals), eat low-fat and low-fiber (or put high-fiber foods in blender to make liquid or soft), and there are a few meds that are used to move the food through more quickly.  But she should ask her doctor about it first.

i have gastroparesis and her symptoms sound like they could fit this diagnosis.  i will sometimes get the "bump" you're describing.  it's really freaky to see your stomach balloon out like that.  she needs to see a gastroenterologist.  a prinary care doctor is NOT good enough for this situation.  i'd encourage her to keep a detailed food diary also that notes symptoms as they relate to what she eats.  the gastric emptying scan is not that bad.  it sucks to eat microwaved radioactive egg whites (NOT that tastiest meal i've ever had, to say the least!) but it is a great diagnostic tool.  she may also need an endoscopy to take a look inside. i had my GES and my endoscopy done the same week and based on those results, my doctor diagnosed me with a mild form of GP.
